CSE 232, Fall 2012, Section 1

Section Policies

Last updated 9/1/12

Lab Instructor/TA: Kenneth Hanson
Lab Sessions: Tues. 6:00-7:50 in 3340 Engineering
Consulting Hours: TBD in 3340 Engineering (or by appointment)

Note: This lab “syllabus” is a supplement to the course syllabus. You are still responsible for everything in the CSE 232 Syllabus, Course Policies, and Coding Standard.

General Information

Email Communication

I will send important information, project feedback, etc. via email in order to save time during lab for programming topics and Q&A. If you don't read your MSU email regularly, set up a forwarder.

You can email me any time with any questions or concerns. I read email at least once a day.

Course and Section Websites

Course Website: www.cse.msu.edu/~cse232
Section Website: www.msu.edu/~hanson54/cse232

Reference materials for the parts of C++, Linux, and g++/Make we're focusing on can be found on both the course and section sites. Look there before you go to Google.

All project files and the entire contents of the course pack are found on the course website.

All lab assignments are posted on the course website, but I may modify some of them and post them on the section site. Check the section site first.

Other section-specific materials and any guides I write will be posted on the section site.

Section Policies

Lab Sessions

  1. Come only to your registered lab section. We don't have enough computers for visitors.
  2. Please come to lab on time. I will often announce important information at the beginning of lab.
  3. You may leave after completing the current week's lab assignment, though I recommend you get started on the next programming project before you leave.
  4. During lab, I will give priority to students who need help with the current lab assignment. I will assist with projects and anything else as time allows.

Lab Assignments

  1. Please check the section website before starting each lab. I will sometimes post a modified version of the lab assignment.
  2. Per course-wide policy:
    1. You are free to work alone or with other students on lab assignments (but not on projects).
    2. I you miss lab due to illness or emergency, please contact me ASAP. If the reason is valid, I will allow you to make up the lab before the beginning of the following lab section.
    3. If you do attend lab, but are unable to complete the are unable to compete a lab assignment by the end of the session, you will be able to complete and turn it in by the following lab session.
    4. You must complete 12 out of the 15 lab assignments in order to receive a non-failing grade in this course. I can give you my record of the labs you've completed at any time, but it is your responsibility to complete and turn in each lab assignment on time.
  3. You are welcome to complete any lab assignment ahead of time, in which case you can show it to me at the beginning of lab.

Programming Projects

  1. Read the assignment specifications and notes documents carefully. Everything you need to do is in there. Ask if you don't understand the instructions.
  2. Per course-wide policy, you may not work with other students on the projects (you can on the labs). The code you submit will be electronically compared with current and past submissions, and it's easy to get your code flagged by working with others even if you didn't intend to cheat.
  3. Contact Mr. McCullen ASAP if you miss a project deadline due to illness or emergency, or have problems with the Handin system when turning in a project.
  4. Do not modify any project files after the due date. If you have any problems with Handin, you will need the timestamps on your files to precede the due date in order to prove that you finished the assignment on time.

Grading

  1. If you think I've made a mistake in my grading, or if any comments I leave on your score sheet are unclear, please email me ASAP.
  2. I will not consider requests to raise a project grade, except in the case where you believe I have graded you unfairly compared to other students in this section.
  3. I will not “pre-grade” projects under any circumstances. This includes but is not limited to questions along the lines of “How many points will I lose if ___ doesn't work when I turn it in?”
  4. See Grading Policies on the section website for details.

Course Support

Consulting Hours

Feel free to come to any TA's consulting hours any time, even just to work on your projects.

Getting Help

See Getting Help on the section website.

Questions and Concerns

Contact me for missed labs and project grading problems.

Contact Mr. McCullen for missed project deadlines (with a valid excuse).

Contact either or both of us if you are struggling with the course or have any other concerns.
